sheetTemplate.name: Starting Ratings
sheetTemplate.editDescription: Choose one set of stats, then add 1 each to two different stats.

sheetTemplate.name: Conditions
items: **Angry:** –2 to **Figure Out a Person**. To clear, break something important to you or someone you care about.
**Frightened:** -2 to **Fight**. To clear, run away and leave something important behind.
**Guilty:** -2 to **Emotional Support**. To clear, sacrifice something important just to hurt yourself for what you did.
**Hopeless:** -2 to **Defy Disaster**. To clear, lose yourself in escapism or pleasure when you should be doing something important.
**Insecure:** -2 to **Entice**. To clear, take rash action to confront the object of your jealousy and prove your worth without any plan or advice.

sheetTemplate.name: Experience (XP)
sheetTemplate.description: Receive experience (XP) whenever you roll a 6- or when a move tells you to mark XP.

sheetTemplate.name: History
sheetTemplate.editDescription: Go around the group. On your turn, pick one of these for each other hunter

children.name: Advances 1
children.description: When you fill your XP track, you gain an Advance from the list. If you’re playing a single session rather than an ongoing game, you earn an Advance every 3 XP instead of every 5.
items: Take another move from your playbook
Take another move from your playbook
Take a move from any playbook
Take a move from any playbook
Add 1 to a stat (max stat of 3)
Add 1 to a stat (max stat of 3)

children.name: Advances 2
children.description: After you take your fifth Advance, you can choose to switch to  another  playbook  or  live  happily  ever after. Choose one of these last two options when the emotional conflict at the core of your playbook has been resolved or eclipsed by a new conflict corresponding to a new playbook.
